title: Lehmann&Riggs-Catholic Church in a Democracy(1947)
description: This is L. H. Lehmann's and Francis Behn Riggs's shocking two-part booklet The Catholic Church in a Democracy (1947) which exposes how the Catholic Church manages to uphold its vast property under the corporate guise and how it then uses its fortunes to subvert the constitution in USA. First part by L. H. Lehmann entitled "The Corporate Status of the Catholic Church in America" is a factual explanation of how the Roman Catholic Church in the United States obtains, and holds on to, its money, property and power. Second part by Francis Behn Riggs entitled "The Threat of Catholicism to American Democracy" is an objective, documented analysis of the aims, power and activities of the Roman Catholic Church in the United States. 30 pages. A must read for everyone.
